courseWork.title: NVOH Chapter 8 "Entering a New Century" Anticipation Guide
courseWork.description:
Use pages 156 - 157 the time line for Chapter 8 in Nevada Our Home
Open the Google Doc
Read the directions
Type the answers to each question in the Before boxes to tell what you Know before reading.
We will check back on this after we read through the chapter to see if our predictions are correct or if we need to write an updated correct answer in the After boxes as we read. 
Remember that you need complete sentences to answer each question.

courseWork.title: NVOH Chapter 7 Assessment
courseWork.description:
You may use your textbook and any materials from Chapter 7 
You may NOT use any internet searches or talking to classmates for the assessment

Multiple Choice, Matching, and Fill in the blank are each worth 1 point and have 1 correct answer
Essay questions require a paragraph format answer in 5 - 8 sentences that answer the question for a total of 10 points each.
Reread your answers.
Remember:
Restate questions
Use evidence from the text
CAPS

courseWork.title: 5/18 NVOH Homework Reading Response:
courseWork.description:
Read pages 146 - 153
Early Nevadans had a character trait we call perseverance (not giving up and continuing to try their best in the face of the unknown), give two examples of people persevering in lesson 4 of chapter 7 NVOH.  
Write a sentence or two to respond to this prompt after you read.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Read pages 146 - 153
Early Nevadans had a character trait we call perseverance (not giving up and continuing to try their best in the face of the unknown), give two examples of people persevering in lesson 4 of chapter 7 NVOH.
Write a sentence or two to respond to this prompt after you read.

shortAnswerSubmission.answer: One way the early Nevadans showed perseverance was when Sarah Winnemucca tried to teach her people about the importance of a good education so they would not give up.  The final way the early Nevadans showed perseverance was when Helen Stewart's husband  was killed she obtained the 1,000 acre ranch in Las Vegas and kept it going.

form.title: Exploring in a Time Machine & Schools Then & Now

courseWork.title: Exploring in a Time Machine & Schools Then & Now
courseWork.description:
Read pages 149 - 151 in Nevada Our Home Chapter 7
Complete the assignment to accompany the material you read about what school might have been like back in the 1800's 
Make sure to use evidence from the text to answer each question. 
***Read ALL Directions Carefully***  

Here are some supplemental links to help see what school was like in the 1800's
https://www.history.com/news/in-early-1800s-american-classrooms-students-governed-themselves
https://curioushistorian.com/schools-in-the-1800s-insight-into-the-life-of-a-pioneer-school-teacher

courseWork.title: Design Your Own Brand
courseWork.description:
Nevada Our Home Chapter 7

Read pages 136 & 137

Review the links in History Google Classroom on Brands and Designing your own brand. 

On a piece of blank paper (Use as much of the paper as you can) create your own brand.  Make this something unique to you, think, "what would be important to you if you owned your own ranch?"  What would this brand say about your ranch?  Write a sentence that tells why it would represent your ranch and what it means.

Take a picture and upload your brand to this assignment.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Nevada Our Home Chapter 7

Read pages 136 & 137

Review the links in History Google Classroom on Brands and Designing your own brand.

On a piece of blank paper (Use as much of the paper as you can) create your own brand. Make this something unique to you, think, "what would be important to you if you owned your own ranch?" What would this brand say about your ranch? Write a sentence that tells why it would represent your ranch and what it means.

Take a picture and upload your brand to this assignment.

courseWork.title: Growing Nevada Map Activity
courseWork.description:
Chapter 7 Nevada Our Home Map Activity

Use a full sheet of paper to draw the map of Nevada on page 131

During 1866 & 1867 many different cultures set up life in Nevada's regions.  These groups lived in different physical regions of Nevada.  

Draw on the map where the following people lived and establishments were formed, their facts are on the pages listed with each

For each group of people or establishment draw something that represents that culture.  For example: Basques lived in the high deserts and mountains, you can draw sheep near Elko, Carson City, and Ely to represent these people. 

Boomtowns (p. 128)
Ranches (pgs. 133 - 135)
Basques (pgs. 138 & 139)
Farms (p. 140)
Railroad City (p. 141)

Draw your Map Key on the outside of the Map and tell what each picture symbol means


When you finish drawing your map please take a picture of it and upload it to this assignment
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Chapter 7 Nevada Our Home Map Activity

Use a full sheet of paper to draw the map of Nevada on page 131

During 1866 & 1867 many different cultures set up life in Nevada's regions. These groups lived in different physical regions of Nevada.

Draw on the map where the following people lived and establishments were formed, their facts are on the pages listed with each

For each group of people or establishment draw something that represents that culture. For example: Basques lived in the high deserts and mountains, you can draw sheep near Elko, Carson City, and Ely to represent these people.

Boomtowns (p. 128)
Ranches (pgs. 133 - 135)
Basques (pgs. 138 & 139)
Farms (p. 140)
Railroad City (p. 141)

Draw your Map Key on the outside of the Map and tell what each picture symbol means


When you finish drawing your map please take a picture of it and upload it to this assignment

courseWork.title: People to Know in Nevada
courseWork.description:
9:30 - 10:30

Independent Work (no zoom)

People to Know in Nevada Chapter 7:

1) Look at the "People to Know" lists in Chapter 7 (page 126, page 133, and page 146).   

2) Choose one historical figure 

3) Read about the historical figure you choose in Chapter 7

4) Create a Google Doc to write about your historical figure 

5) Write a paragraph about your person: Include how this person had an impact on a place or region of Nevada 



This should be written in a Paragraph format:

Open a Google Doc by clicking the + Create button 

Please put your name, date, and title at the top of the paragraph 

Press enter once to start your paragraph 

Remember to Indent.

Topic Sentence 

3 sets of detail/explanation sentences (6 total sentences for detail/explanation) 

Closing Sentence 

CAPS

courseWork.title: Chapter 6 "Making a Home in Nevada" Assessment
courseWork.description:
This assessment is open book, you may use your Nevada Our Home Textbook to answer the questions.  This work is Independent, not partner time.  We will zoom through this to be able to monitor that everyone is working independently.
There are 5 sections to this assessment including:
1) Multiple Choice
2) Vocabulary matching
3) Fill in the Blank
4) Chart skills
5) Essay questions
Remember that on short answer and essay questions you need to use text based format:
1) Restate the question
2) use text evidence
3)CAPS

courseWork.title: Chautauqua Script
courseWork.description:
Good Morning,
Please click create and select doc
Put your Name and number at the top
Give your Chautauqua a title
Please use 12 point font in Arial or Times New Roman for your script
Please click the spacing tool and make your script double (2.0) spaced.
Reread for accuracy before you turn in.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Good Morning,
Please click create and select doc
Put your Name and number at the top
Give your Chautauqua a title
Please use 12 point font in Arial or Times New Roman for your script
Please click the spacing tool and make your script double (2.0) spaced.
Reread for accuracy before you turn in.

comments.comment:
Loz this seems quite short.  Please work on adding more detail.  For example you say "I encountered John C. Fremont" ...When, Where, What happened, Why?  You need to tell why this is important.  What are things you can add more detail about to this script. 
You have a lot of " I Kit Carson" sentences starters.  It reads and sounds repetitive. Think of how you can develop these sentences to say more and you don't have to say Kit Carson in every sentence.  I will know you are in character as Kit Carson.  Speak as if you would about yourself on the daily.
comments.commentHtml:
Loz this seems quite short. Please work on adding more detail. For example you say "I encountered John C. Fremont" ...When, Where, What happened, Why? You need to tell why this is important. What are things you can add more detail about to this script.
You have a lot of " I Kit Carson" sentences starters. It reads and sounds repetitive. Think of how you can develop these sentences to say more and you don't have to say Kit Carson in every sentence. I will know you are in character as Kit Carson. Speak as if you would about yourself on the daily.
